description: {CT{che {CW{caterwheel {yis a simple machine designed for many functions.
This one is attached to the bellows in the blacksmith shop next door.
{CW{cater from the {Cstream{y is diverted to the wheel, making it spin and
pump the bellows, freeing up the smith to focus on the other aspects
of his trade.  {x
40449.name: The Waterwheel

description: The highest reaches of the manor, this small passageway has low
ceilings, and little light, save for a few oil lamps scattered along
its length.  A small wooden staircased leads down to the side hall,
and there is a door to the east.  The attic hall continues to the
north.
40462.name: The Attic Hall

description: {GThe east lawn is a well manicured affair.  A thick carpet of grass
has been trimmed short, but provides a soft cushion to walk upon,
lending a spring to one's step.  Pleasure and childlike joy radiate
with each placement of a foot.  The east lawn curves around the east
wing of the manor and leads to the Rose Gardens.  West can be seen the
Terrace of the Fountains.  {x
40410.name: The East Lawn

description: {gThe Boxwood Maze is a truly confusing construction.  Normally one
entering a maze would follow one direction until they came to the
appropriate exit, but the boxwood maze of the {CJ{co{Yy{cb{wr{Yi{wn{cg{Ye{cr{Cs {g appears to
have been augmented by magic, and the doors shift randomly in time.
The manor house remains to the east, with no apparent exit to that
location, and the west lawn lies somewhere to the south.  {x
40453.name: The Boxwood Maze

description: The kitchens are a functional space, not frilly, but functional.
Large fireplaces stand against the eastern wall with spits for
roasting meats, hobs for hanging stewpots, and ovens for baking bread.
Along the west wall are sinks and preparation stations for all the
hard work that goes into preparing dishes prior to cooking.  The
center of the room is dominated by a large table that expands the work
space for the numerous cooks bustling about preparing dishes for
members of the {CJ{co{Yy{cb{Cr{ci{Yn{cg{Ce{cr{Ys{x and their guests.  The formal dining hall
lies just to the north of the Kitchens.  {x
40438.name: Kitchens

description: {cA small room with a writing desk, an armchair, and asmall pallet
along the wall.  These are the small comforts members of the
Joybringers chosing to live within the manor may expect.  All othe
rcreature comforts and personal designs are to be provided by the
individual member.  Those desiring to occupy rooms within the manor
are expected to pay a rental fee to the organization in the amount of
500 platinum per month.  {x
[{RFOR RENT{x]
40459.name: Clan Member Room

description: {8This narrow hall rises nearly twelve feet culminating in a gothic
arch.  The hall is constructed of stone, and has none of the bright
and glossy appearance of the main halls of the manor, but is more
utilitarian in nature.  A single heavy oak door leads to the east.  {x
40457.name: A Small Side Hall

description: {yThis small foot bridge {gcontinues the peacefull path through the
woods north of the manor.  Oak and Maple trees dominate the landscape.
In the distance to the north, the sound of a hammer ringing on an
anvil can be heard, and the air is laced with the scent of {8smoke{g, both
from a fire and a pipe.  {x
40447.name: The Bridge over the Stream

description: {cThis circular room provides near perfect acoustics for the playing
of music.  A small lancet {Cwindow{c provides some filtered light in the
north wall.  The floor is sunken with two steps leading down to a
large custom sofa.  The walls are hung with instruments of all kind,
allowing members to select and practice what suits their needs for the
moment.  {x
40442.name: Music Room

description: The back terrace overlooks the back gardens and the forest to the
north.  Down a set of stone steps, the back gardens spread out with
flagstone paths winding between fruit trees and other shrubs.  The
terrace itself is small in comparison to many of the structures around
the manor, but provides just enough room for an intimate conversation,
or room for one to sit down and write in the peace of the outdoors.  {x
40429.name: The Back Terrace

description: {wTo maintain continuity with the other major passages within the
manor, the west wing hall is clad entirely in white marble.  The most
quiet and private bedroom in the manor lies to the north.  To the
east, the west wing hall continues, an the west wing stair lies to the
west.  {x
40432.name: The West Wing Hall

description: {CThe dining hall is a festive place.  It is here that the
J{co{Yy{cb{Cr{ci{Yn{cg{Ce{cr{Ys{C hold banquets and other affairs or parties.  The dining
hall is located in close proximity to the Ballroom, with large sets of
french doors constantly open to that grand space, allowing revellers
easy access to the dance floor if the mood should take them, as well
as allowing for music to waft down from the musician's balcony above.
The kitchens lie to the south, while the east hall is just north.  {x
40437.name: The Formal Dining Hall

description: The west wing stair winds up to this small round room with a single
doorway to the east.  This stair provides members a less grand way to
access the second floor, particularly the parts of the west wing.  {x
40433.name: The West Wing Stair

description: {GThe back lawn is a wide expanse of grass, neatly trimmed with small
colorful shrubs mingled throughout, breaking up the monotony of a wide
swath of lawn.  South is a stunning rose garden, while a small path
enters the woods to the east.  {x
40408.name: The Back Lawn

description: {gThe Boxwood Maze is a truly confusing construction.  Normally one
entering a maze would follow one direction until they came to the
appropriate exit, but the boxwood maze of the {CJ{co{Yy{cb{wr{Yi{wn{cg{Ye{cr{Cs {g appears to
have been augmented by magic, and the doors shift randomly in time.
The manor house remains to the east, with no apparent exit to that
location, and the west lawn lies somewhere to the south.  {x
40454.name: The Boxwood Maze

description: {wThis wide marble corridor leads to the more quiet side of the
manor's second floor, with the exception of the Musician's Balcony to
the south, which can be fairly raucous during festivals and balls held
in the room below.  A quiet study lies to the north, and the hall
continues east.  To the west is the second floor landing looking over
the Grand Rotunda.  {x
40434.name: The East Wing Hall

description: {cThe conservatory is a cross between a greenhouse and a lounge.
Thousands of plants are raised here, many of them quite rare.  The air
in this largely glass room is humid, and has the pleasant aromas of
damp earth and flowers.  A feeling of peace emanates from this room,
at least for those whose hearts lead them towards nature.  {x
40441.name: Conservatory

description: {yA small dirt path {gleads into the woods, curving towards the north
where a {yfoot bridge {garcs gracefully over a {Cb{ca{wb{Cb{wl{ci{Cn{wg {Cb{cr{Wo{co{Ck{g.  The trees
are fairly well spaced out at this location, owing to the proximity to
the edge of the wood.  {GFerns {gfill in the understory with a lush
carpet.  {x
40446.name: A Path through the Woods

description: This sitting room has several purposes.  On a daily basis, it
provides comfortable seating for members of the {CJ{co{Yy{cb{Cr{ci{Yn{cg{Ce{cr{Ys{x to sit,
chat, and relax.  During events and and dancing, it provides a quiet
location for revelers to get away from the heat and noise of the dance
floor and sit down to recover.  The entrance hall to the manor lies to
the east.  {x
40418.name: Sitting Room

description: {CThe Terrace of Fountains{8, so named for the circular flagstone paths
surrounding a large central {Cf{cou{wnt{cai{Cn {8depicting {cthree dolphins leaping
in a {Cwa{wve{8 flanked by a pair of smaller {Cf{cou{wn{Ct{wa{cin{Cs {8with simple designs
focused around the play of the {Cw{cat{wer {8through the {wair {8more than the
design of the stone scuplutre.  The overall effect is both stunning
and musical lending an aura of peace to the area.  North the Grand
Entrance to the Manor can be seen, while the lawns continue to the
east and west.  {x
40402.name: The Terrace of Fountains

description: {GThe west lawn is a well manicured affair.  A thick carpet of grass
has been trimmed short, but provides a soft cushion to walk upon.  A
springy step is a side effect of this treatment, and pleasure radiates
out from every step.  The west lawn leads around the west side of the
manor, with a Boxwood Maze located to the down.  The Terrace of
Fountains lies to the east.  {x
40404.name: The West Lawn

description: {CThe Leaders' Office is just that, a working office space.  This is
where the day-to-day adminstration is taken care of.  Two desks sit in
the room, one on each the east and west walls.  A small {8leaded {wglass
window{C is in the northern wall, while heavily carved door stands in
the south wall of the room.  The east wing hall lies just so the
south.  {x
40456.name: Leader's Office

description: {Y{YT{yhe {YJ{yoybringer's {YS{ytables are a modest affair.  A small building
with stalls for a dozen or so horses is all that exist here.  The
pleasant aroma of dried hay comes from the loft.  The simplicity of
the building belies the quality of the stock, however, and the dapple
grey horses bred by the stablemaster are the finest in the realms.  {x
40470.name: The Joy Bringer's Stables

description: {GThe back garden is a small affair of winding flagstone paths
leading ending in the edge of the forest.  Fruit trees are spread
throughout this garden, and small flower and vegetable beds add a
sprinkling of color to the landscap.  The back terrace of the manor is
just up a set of {8wide stone steps,{G and the back lawn is to the east.
To the west one of the flagstone paths disappears into the trees.  {x
40407.name: The Back Garden

description: {cA small room with a writing desk, an armchair, and asmall pallet
along the wall.  These are the small comforts members of the
Joybringers chosing to live within the manor may expect.  All othe
rcreature comforts and personal designs are to be provided by the
individual member.  Those desiring to occupy rooms within the manor
are expected to pay a rental fee to the organization in the amount of
500 platinum per month.  {x
[{RFOR RENT{x]
40465.name: Clan Member Room

description: The east wing stair rises from the lower level to a small landing
here.  West lies the east wing hall, a marble clad room stretching
westwards to the balcony over the Grand Rotunda.  This stair provides
quiet access for members to their private rooms.  {x
40436.name: The East Wing Stair

description: {wThe west hall, like the main hall, is clad in gleaming white
marble.  The floors ring with musical notes as members of the
{CJ{co{Yy{cb{Cr{ci{Yn{cg{Ce{cr{Ys{w move about their daily routines.  The walls here are
covered in portraits of the members of this hall.  East the hall
continues, while to the west, there is a small spiral staircase
leading to the second floor.  {x
40427.name: The West Hall

description: The east hall, like the main hall, is clad in gleaming white
marble.  The floors ring with the footsteps of all who pass by and
reflect their visages in the highly polished surface.  The walls are
covered with paintings of hunting scenes.  West lies the Grand
Rotunda, east the hall continues, and the north ballroom lies to the
south.  {x
40423.name: The East Hall

description: {gThe Boxwood Maze is a truly confusing construction.  Normally one
entering a maze would follow one direction until they came to the
appropriate exit, but the boxwood maze of the {CJ{co{Yy{cb{wr{Yi{wn{cg{Ye{cr{Cs {g appears to
have been augmented by magic, and the doors shift randomly in time.
The manor house remains to the east, with no apparent exit to that
{glocation, and the west lawn lies somewhere to the south.  {x
40455.name: The Boxwood Maze

description: {rThe marble floors of the surrounding halls give way to richly
inlaid wood floors in the ballroom.  The ceiling soars to the full
forty foot height over the central floor, with balconies lining the
east and west walls of the second floor.  Music can be heard drifting
down from the musician's balcony above, and the dance floor stretches
out far to the south.  Double doors open up onto the east hall to the
north.  {x
40420.name: North Ballroom

description: {gThe Boxwood Maze is a truly confusing construction.  Normally one
entering a maze would follow one direction until they came to the
appropriate exit, but the boxwood maze of the {CJ{co{Yy{cb{wr{Yi{wn{cg{Ye{cr{Cs {g appears to
have been augmented by magic, and the doors shift randomly in time.
The manor house remains to the east, with no apparent exit to that
location, and the west lawn lies somewhere to the south.  {x
40405.name: The Boxwood Maze

description: {gThe trunks of immense big leaf maples and oaks dominate the forest
here, with the occasional douglas fir mixed in occasionally.  The
understory is dominated by ferns and salal, through which a small game
trail winds, moving to and fro as only a trail created by animals can.
In the canopy, the sounds of chattering squirrels and chirping birds
can be readily heard.  What appears to be a manicured hedge lies to
the north, while the trail winds down the slope of a small hill.  {x
40412.name: A Game Trail through the Woods

description: {rA s{ymall {rd{yir{rt p{yat{rh {gmeanders through the woods creating the ideal in
tranquil settings.  Dappled light filters through the leaves of the
stately oaks and maples that make up the edge of the forest.  The path
heads north into the woods, while a small back garden is to the east.
{gThe boxwood maze is down and to the south, while the manor house can
be seen just to the southeast.  {x
40406.name: A Path through the Woods

description: {wWide marble stairs sweep up from the Grand Rotunda below, curving
around from both the left and right to this balcony.  {wThe {Cglass dome{w
arching overhead allows clear views of the sky, and at night,
spectacular views of the stars.  Marble halls run east and west from
the landing, leading to the quieter and less public rooms of the
manor.  {x
40430.name: The Second Floor Landing

description: {YA s{ymall foot bridge {gcrosses over a {Cb{cur{wb{cli{Cn{wg {Cs{ct{wr{ce{Ca{wm{g allowing the
path to continue to meander through the woods.  Familiar smells and
sounds begin to radiate through the air giving a feeling of home.  {rA
S{ymall {rs{ytable {glies to the west and the sounds of jangling tack and
horses comes from that direction.  To the east, a strange buzzing or
humming sound comes from a small building with a large mesh mesh
canopy.  {-F{-l{-o{-w{-e{-r{-s{g grow everywhere around the structure, save for a
small path leading to a little round door.  {x
40411.name: A Stream through the Woods

description: {8The western portion of the front terrace is framed by {wmarble
balusters{8 supporting intricately carved ralings.  While no entrances
to the manor are located on the western terrace, it provides an
excellent vantage point to view people wandering through the boxwood
maze below or to look out over the western portions of the estate.  {x
40415.name: The Front Terrace

description: {8This cramped stair leads down into the darkness.  All organizations
have their secrets, and it is here that the {CJ{co{Yy{cb{Cr{ci{Yn{cg{Ce{cr{Ys{8 hide theirs.
The air is quite damp, and in the distance, water can be heard slowly
dripping from some surface.  The stairs down are cut from natural
rock, and worn with the passing of many footsteps.  {x
40451.name: The Secret Stair

description: {8A small spiral stair winds up to the second floor.  While it is
described as small, this is a relative term when compared to the grand
staircases in the Rotunda.  East lies the West Hall, while top of the
west wing stair is above.  {x
40428.name: The West Stair

description: {gThe surrounding forest stops suddenly in a tall, well manicured yew
hedge.  There is a gap in the hedge with a large {8wrought iron gate.
{gAtop the gate is a large sculpture of a {Rruby-throated {Ghu{gmm{Cin{ggb{Gir{cd {g
looking out over the forest.  A flagstone path leads out from the gap
into well manicured lawns and beautiful grounds.  In the distance an
ivy covered manor house can be seen.  {x
40400.name: A Gap in the Hedge

description: {8A set of wide stone stairs leads up to an impressive terrace.  The
terrace fronts the entire face of the manor, and truly frames the
impressive building.  It is only from the grand entrance that one can
truly take in the magnificance of this impressive edifice.  Built in
the high style of the Empire, the manor house boasts numerous towers.
In a lavish display of wealth, {wleaded glass{8 and {-s{-t{-a{-i{-n{-e{-d {-g{-l{-a{-s{-s {wwindows
{8dot the facade like jewels, catching and reflecting the light.  {GI{gv{Gy
{8climbs the walls, further enhancing the grandeur of the building.
South lies the terrace of fountains, while the manor awaits up the
stairs.  {x
40403.name: The Grand Entrance

description: {8The front terrace of {CJ{co{Yy{cb{Cr{ci{Yn{cg{Ce{cr {YM{ca{Cn{co{Yr{8 sets a magnificent stage for
looking over the front grounds of the estate.  The central portion of
the terrace is holds the stairs leading down to the well manicured
grounds.  {wMarble balusters {8support intricately carved railings edging
the terrace and framing in the grand terrace.  The terrace continues
to the east and west.  The Manor's Entrance hall lies through a
heavily carved double door.  {x
40414.name: The Front Terrace

description: {rA stout mahogany railing{c provides protection for those browsing
through the stacks on the upper level of the library.  This railing
forms a balcony circling the two-story {Cw{wi{cn{Cd{co{ww{Cs{c in the east wall.  The
view from this balcony is astounding as it looks over the {gforest{c to
the west of the manor and beyond.  The bookshelves on this level of
the library are home to topics more arcane than those on the lower
level, dealing with healing, magical arts, potion making and the like.
A small door in the north wall leads to a hall in the west wing of the
manor.  {x
40440.name: Library - Upper Level

description: {RT{rh{Me {RR{ro{Ms{re {RG{ra{Mr{rd{Me{Rn {gof the {CJ{co{Yy{cb{Cr{ci{Yn{cg{Ce{cr{Y'{cs {8M{Wa{wn{Wo{8r {ghas won numerous awards
from the horticultural societies of the realms.  Master Gardeners from
all over come merely to look upon their speldor.  The elves were so
taken with the gardens, that they enchanted it to always be high
summer so that the {Rr{ro{Ms{re{ms {gare always in {Rb{rl{Mo{ro{mm{g.  North lies the back
lawn, while the east lawn lies to the south.  {x
40409.name: The Rose Garden

description: The meditation chamber of the joybringers is a austere room.  The
floor is covered with a {ccyan carpet{x running from wall to wall.  A
small altar with an incense burner sits against the north wall, and a
shoe shelf against the south wall indicates that all visitors to this
space should leave their shoes at the door.  {x
40450.name: The Meditation Chamber

description: {gThis small game trail intersects with the Shire Forest Road to the
west, and is truly just a game trail.  The narrow winding path climbs
back and forth up the hill, moving between the trunks of large big
leaf maples and oaks.  The understory is dominated by a dense
undergrowth of sword fern and salal, making the game trail barely
recognizable.  {x
40413.name: A Game Trail through the Woods

description: {cA small room with a writing desk, an armchair, and asmall pallet
along the wall.  These are the small comforts members of the
Joybringers chosing to live within the manor may expect.  All othe
rcreature comforts and personal designs are to be provided by the
individual member.  Those desiring to occupy rooms within the manor
are expected to pay a rental fee to the organization in the amount of
500 platinum per month.  {x
[{RFOR RENT{x]
40460.name: Clan Member Room

description: {8The blacksmith's shop is a pair of small buildings, the shop itself
and the waterwheel located just to the east.  The shop is of simple
wood construction with exposed beams and tools of the trade hanging on
all the walls.  A Large bellows is built into the eastern side of the
shop, and appears to be mechanically driven.  The Forge itself is a
huge affair dominating the north wall.  Anvils of differing sizes are
spread in a semicircle around the forge.  {x
40448.name: The Blacksmith's Shop

description: {wThe entrance hall forms the front portion of the main hall of the
{CJ{co{Yy{cb{Cr{ci{Yn{cg{Ce{cr{Y'{cs {CM{ca{Yn{co{Cr{w.  Polished marble floors reflect light streaming
down from {Cskylights{w forming the gothic arched ceiling nearly forty
feet above.  The walls are decorated in fair ribons and banners from
many cities of the realms, as well as rich tapestries depicting the
beauties of nature.  West is a warm sitting room, while to the east is
the southern portion of the ballroom.  The main hall continues to the
north and the front terrace lies to the south.  {x
40417.name: The Entrance Hall of the Manor

description: {8This room has the look and smell of an ancient dungeon, damp dank
aromas permeate the air.  A tall wooden post stands in the middle of
the room, with a set of manacles chained high up on the post.  The
walls of this chamber house tools that can only be described as
torture devices.  {x
40452.name: The Whipping Post

description: {wEncased in white marble, the east wing hall leads from the east
wing stair to the balcony overlooking the Grand Rotunda.  A small,
quiet side hall leads to the south.
40435.name: The East Wing Hall

description: {CThis small but comfortable shop houses several different spinning
wheels.  Skeins of yarn in varying colors are stacked in cubicles
along the west wall, while bags of undyed wool are stacked along the
north, awaiting spinning.  The Blacksmith's Shop lies to the east.  {x
40474.name: The Weaver's Shop

description: {rThe marble floors of the surrounding halls give way to richly
inlaid wood floors in the ballroom.  The walls are hung with {Cr{ci{Yc{ch
{Cf{ca{Yb{cr{Ci{cc{Ys{r in the colors of the {CJ{co{Yy{cb{Cr{ci{Yn{cg{Ce{cr {YP{ca{Cr{ca{Yd{ce {CB{ca{Yn{cn{Ce{cr{Ys{r.  The dance
floor stretches out to the north, while large double doors open west
into the Entrance Hall of the mannor.  A Small back staircase leads up
to the south ballroom balcony above.  {x
40419.name: South Ballroom

description: {8This narrow hall rises nearly twelve feet culminating in a gothic
arch.  The hall is constructed of unpolished granite, owing to its
utilitarian nature.  This part of the manor is not a public space, and
is reserved for members of the clan.  {x {8A small wooden staircase leads
upwards towards the attic space.  {x
40458.name: A Small Side Hall

description: {wThe main hall, ascending to the skylights forty feet above, is clad
entirely in white marble.  The walls in this portion of the hall are
covered in tapestries depicting many of the cities of the realms.  {x
The library of the {CJ{co{Yy{cb{Cr{ci{Yn{cg{Ce{cr{Ys{w is to the west, while the hall opens
into a grand rotundat to the north where the Grand Staircase is
located.  South lies the Entrance Hall of the Manor.  {x
40421.name: The Main Hall

description: {cA stair descends from either side of the balcony, meeting at a
landing before continuing as one down to the dance floor.  The balcony
is split, passing along both the east and west sides of the second
floor, providing excellent views of the dance floor below.  These
balconies are used by revelers in need of a short break, but who want
to remain a part of the festivities, and more than one sultry liaison
has been initiated from these heady heights.  {x
40445.name: South Ballroom Balcony

description: The highest hall of the manor, the Attic Hall is a small passageway
with relatively low ceilings and little light.  Oil lamps are
scattered along it's length, and there is a door in the east wall.
The attic hall continues both north and south.  {x
40466.name: The Attic Hall

description: {wThe west hall, like the main hall, is clad in gleaming white
marble.  The floors ring with musical notes as members of the
{CJ{co{Yy{cb{Cr{ci{Yn{cg{Ce{cr{Ys{w move about their daily routines.  The walls here are
covered in portraits of the rulers of the realms.  East lies the Grand
Rotunda, while to the west the hall continues.  {x
40426.name: The West Hall

description: {cA small room with a writing desk, an armchair, and asmall pallet
along the wall.  These are the small comforts members of the
Joybringers chosing to live within the manor may expect.  All othe
rcreature comforts and personal designs are to be provided by the
individual member.  Those desiring to occupy rooms within the manor
are expected to pay a rental fee to the organization in the amount of
500 platinum per month.  {x
[{RFOR RENT{x]
40463.name: Clan Member Room

description: {8The eastern portion of the front terrace is framed by {wmarble
balusters{8 supporting intricately carved ralings.  While no entrances
to the manor are located on the eastern terrace, it provides an
excellent vantage point to view people wandering through the {RR{ro{Ms{re
{RG{ra{Mr{rd{Re{Mn{8 below or to look out over the eastern portions of the estate.{x
40416.name: The Front Terrace

description: {8A small spiral stair winds up to the second floor.  While it is
described as small, this is a relative term when compared to the grand
staircase in the Rotunda.  West lies the east hall, while the top of
the east wing stair is above.
{x
40425.name: The East Stair

description: The highest hall of the manor, the Attic Hall is a small passageway
with relatively low ceilings and little light.  Oil lamps are
scattered along it's length, and there is a door in the east wall.
The attic hall terminates at this point with a small window looking
over the back gardens.
40468.name: The Attic Hall

description: {wThe wide white marble floors of the west wing hall echo with
footsteps of those treading the halls.  The west wing hall continues
to the west, while to the east lies the second floor landing over the
Grand Rotunda.  A small carven door leads south to the upper library,
while the music room of the {CJ{co{Yy{cb{Cr{ci{Yn{cg{Ce{cr{Ys{w lies to the north.  {x
40431.name: The West Wing Hall

description: {wThe Grand Rotunda is formed by the intersection of the three
primary corridors of the {CJ{co{Yy{cb{Cr{ci{Yn{cg{Ce{cr {YM{ca{Cn{co{Yr{w.  This is the point where
the main hall, the east hall and the west hall meet.  The room is a
large circle, with a {Cglass dome {warching high overhead, and a grand
staircase sweeping up and around from each side, rising to the second
floor landing.  To the north is a wall of {Cwindows{w looking out over the
back grounds and forest.  {x
40422.name: The Grand Rotunda

description: {cBook cases line the walls from floor to the heights of the two
story ceiling.  A Library ladder allows access to the second floor
here, and a mahogany railing protects those perusing the shelves on
the second floor.  Here on the lower level, the books cover topics of
history, seamanship, gardening, and a host of other topics.  The east
wall is covered in floor to ceiling {Cw{ci{wn{cd{wo{cw{Cs{c allowing significant light
into the room.  {YO{yil {YL{yamp{Ys {crest on side tables spaced around the room
providing light sources for the evenings where members of the
{CJ{co{Yy{cb{Cr{ci{Yn{cg{Ce{cr{Ys{c spend time in research or just reading for enjoyment.  {x
40439.name: Library - Lower Level

description: The leader's room is a large room, designed for the comfort of the
leader of the {CJ{co{Yy{cb{Cr{ci{Yn{cg{Ce{cr{Ys{x.  More of a suite than a room, this is where
leaders retire from their duties and have the peace and solitude where
they actually get work done.  A pair of {Cleaded glass windows{x opens up
to the north, providing stunning views of the {Ggardens{x below, and the
{gforest{x stretching out far to the north.
40461.name: Leader's Room

description: {cA small room with a writing desk, an armchair, and asmall pallet
along the wall.  These are the small comforts members of the
Joybringers chosing to live within the manor may expect.  All othe
rcreature comforts and personal designs are to be provided by the
individual member.  Those desiring to occupy rooms within the manor
are expected to pay a rental fee to the organization in the amount of
500 platinum per month.  {x
[{RFOR RENT{x]
40469.name: Clan Member Room

description: The Study is a quite room for members of the order to sit and work
on individual projects.  It is here that quiet hobies are undertaken,
as well as studying or planning for various events.  A large {Ccasement
window{x stands in the north wall, providing a stunning view of the back
gardens and forest below.  A small fireplace provides warmth on cold
nights.  Overall, it is a tranquil retreat.  {x
40443.name: Study

description: {gThe aviary of the joybringers consists of a small building and then
an incredibly large aviary, a gigantic mesh canopy held up on long
poles reaching high into the sky.  {-F{-l{-o{-w{-e{-r{-s{g of many kinds grow within
the aviary all having one thing in common, their production of nectar.
A sweet smell pervades the air, and the buzzing sound heard outside
{gcomes from the wings of dozens of {RRuby-throated {Ghu{gmm{Cin{ggb{Gir{cds.  {x
40472.name: The Joybringers' Aviary

description: {wThis portion of the east hall is clad in white marble, like all the
halls of the manor.  In a slight change from those other locations,
however, there is significant seating in this portion of the hall.
The walls are covered in paintings of seaports.  The west stair
spirals up to the east, and the east hall continues west of here.
South lies the {CF{co{Yr{cm{Ca{cl {YD{ci{Cn{ci{Yn{cg {CH{ca{Yl{cl{w of the {CJ{co{Yy{cb{Cr{ci{Yn{cg{Ce{cr{Ys{w lies to the
south.  {x
40424.name: The East Hall

description: {cThe Musician's Balcony circles around the northern portion of the
ballroom below, allowing the musicians clear view of the dancers
below, and conducting superb sound to the revellers waltzing across
the floor.  A small door to the north allows musicians to move in and
out as unobtrusively as possibe, stepping out into the east wing hall.
{x
40444.name: Musician's Balcony

description: {cA small room with a writing desk, an armchair, and asmall pallet
along the wall.  These are the small comforts members of the
Joybringers chosing to live within the manor may expect.  All othe
rcreature comforts and personal designs are to be provided by the
individual member.  Those desiring to occupy rooms within the manor
are expected to pay a rental fee to the organization in the amount of
500 platinum per month.  {x
[{RFOR RENT{x]
40467.name: Clan Member Room

description: {8A flagstone path {Gwinds through the lawns, heading towards the manor
house.  Stone sculptures of beasts fantastic and mundane are scattered
over the grounds, intermixed with topiaries.  Everywhere one looks,
the eye is drawn to a different piece of artwork.  The sound of
{Cgurgling water{G can be heard in the distance.  {x
40401.name: The Flagstone Path

description: The highest hall of the manor, the Attic Hall is a small passageway
with relatively low ceilings and little light.  Oil lamps are
scattered along it's length, and there is a door in the east wall.
The attic hall continues both north and south.  {x
40464.name: The Attic Hall

credits: [ CLNHLL ] Hall of the Joy Bringers
name: The Joy Bringers (Clan Hall 2010)

description:
Ivy is the Joybringer's master gardener, spending most of her time
in maintenance of the fabulous grounds around the manor.  When she is
not outdoors gardening, she is working on her potions, or relaxing in
the conservatory.  All Ivy's potions are made from plant extracts
taken from plants grown directly on the manor grounds.
40400.room_name: {GI{wv{gy{8, the {Gm{ga{Ys{gt{Ge{wr {Gg{ga{Yr{gd{Ge{gn{we{Gr{8 and {cpotion mistress{8 of the {CJ{co{Yy{cb{Cr{ci{Yn{cg{Ce{cr{Ys{8 relaxes in her {Cc{co{wn{gs{Ge{gr{Cv{ga{Gt{go{wr{Gy{g.{x
40400.name: {GI{wv{gy{x~

description:
Lord Hellebore is a sturdy man, accustomed to hard work outdoors. 
He is the stablemaster for the Joybringers, as was his father before
him, and he prides himself in the quality of the horses that come out
of his stables.  Hellebore's Dapple Greys are the finest in the
realms.
40401.name: {GL{gor{Gd {GH{Me{mll{8e{mbo{Mr{Ge{x~

description:
Lady Acanthus is a striking woman.  Although she is small, her
exceptionally fine features hint at some fey heritage.  Perhaps this
explains her afinity for both these delicate plants and the tiny birds
around which she thrives.
40402.name: {ML{wad{My A{mc{wa{Mnt{wh{mu{Ms{x~

description:
Lord Foxglove is a handsome man, but all accounts.  He is
impeccably dressed, with not a speck of dirt, or blood for that
matter, upon him.  While handsome, he is not a warm or friendly man,
and the only time he has been seen to smile is when his {Ci{wc{Cy b{wl{cu{Ce{x eyes
stare into yours as he {Rs{rlits your throat.  {x
40403.room_name: {GL{gor{Gd {GF{Mo{mx{8g{mlo{Mv{Ge{8 stand here, ready to ease your pain... permanently.{x
40403.name: {GL{gor{Gd {GF{Mo{mx{8g{mlo{Mv{Ge{x~

description:
An attractive young woman whose culinary talents far surpass her
age.  Violet stands about 5'11" tall and unlike most cooks, is slender
with the right mix of curves.  She has black hair and shocking purple
eyes for which she was named.  {x
40404.room_name: {MV{Bi{Mo{Bl{Me{Bt{M, e{Bx{Me{Bc{Mu{Bt{Mi{Bv{Me {Bc{Mh{Be{Mf{8 of the {CJ{co{Yy{cb{Cr{ci{Yn{cg{Ce{cr{Ys{8 stands here governing over the kitchen staff.{x
40404.name: {MV{Bi{Mo{Bl{Me{Bt{x~

description:
Lord Aster is a well reputed jewler throughout the realms.  He is
middle-aged with salt and pepper hair, and a hawklike nose.  A pair of
half-moon spectacles perch upon his nose giving him the appearance of
looking down at his clients at all times.  Haing retired several years
ago, most of the jewelry in his shop is crafted elsewhere in the
realms.
40406.room_name: {CL{cor{Cd A{cs{Yt{ce{Cr, {CJ{ce{Yw{cl{Ce{cr{8 of the {CJ{co{Yy{cb{Cr{ci{Yn{cg{Ce{cr{Ys{x tends his shop.
40406.name: {CL{cor{Cd A{cs{Yt{ce{Cr, {CJ{ce{Yw{cl{Ce{cr{8 of the {CJ{co{Yy{cb{Cr{ci{Yn{cg{Ce{cr{Ys{x~

description:
Lord Snapdragon is the blacksmith for the Joybringers.  Enjoying
his solitude, he remains outside the manor, prefering to stay in the
woods at the edge of the property.  Lord Snapdragon is the veteran of
many battles, but as he reached middle age, he retired from the
soldiering life, chosing instead to contribute to battles by forging
beautiful implements for the next generation to wield and wear into
battle.
40407.name: {GL{gor{Gd {RS{rn{gap{Md{Rr{ra{ggo{Rn, {8the Blacksmith{x~
40407.keywords: lord snap dragon snapdragon black smith blacksmith~

description:
Iris is the Healer of the Joybringers.  Trained as a healer from a
young age, she is well known for her tender touch and the floral
scents of her healing oils.  There is little Iris cannot care for.
40408.room_name: {BI{br{Yi{bs{B, {8the {BH{be{Ya{bl{Be{br {8of the {CJ{co{Yy{cb{Cr{ci{Yn{cg{Ce{cr{Ys{8 stands here ready to tend your wounds.{x
40408.name: {BI{br{Yi{bs{B, {8the {BH{be{Ya{bl{Be{br{x~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

description:
These hummingbirds seem to be whereever the Joybringers tread. 
Their bright colors and whimsical personalities seem to accentuate the
nature of the organization.
40409.name: {GA {RRuby-throated {GHu{gmm{Cin{ggb{Gir{cd{x~

description:
Bred in the stables of Lord Hellebore, these magnificent animals
are the exclusive mounts for the Joybringers.  Their sleek coats and
exquisite markings make these horses desireable for that alone, but
when coupled with their fine bones and fleet feet, these horses are
prime examples of what every horse should be.
40410.name: {8A {wD{8ap{Wpl{we {WG{wre{8y {wH{Wo{8r{wse{x~
subroutines:
F aff c
F res N
F vul M
F par G

description:
Lady Snapdragon is the wife of the Blacksmith of the Joybringers. 
Her grey hair is pulled back, adding to the severe appearance of her
hawklike face.  Her eyes seem to be watching you with a piercing and
knowing look.
40411.name: {GL{gad{Gy {RS{rn{gap{Md{Rr{ra{ggo{Rn,{8 the {Cw{ce{Ya{cv{Ce{cr{x~
